instructionsOverlay.title: Orbital Architecture – Multitasking
instructionsOverlay.intro:
In this test you will practice doing multiple things at once.
The screen is divided into 5 parts; one part shows your System Status, and four tasks (System Monitoring, Tracking auto, Communication task, Resource Management) that you need to keep track of.
instructionsOverlay.sysStat:
System status shows how your entire system is performing.
By monitoring and solving the four different tasks, you try to keep the system Health as high as possible and the Load as low as possible.
We will now go through the different tasks and practice them one by one before trying them all simultaneously.
instructionsOverlay.sysMon:
In this task you will check 6 gauges: F1-F6.
You need to correct the system if:
• F1 stops being green - Correct by clicking F1
• F2 becomes red - Correct by clicking F2
• F3-F6 dot moves outside the gray center interval to the pink/red parts - Correct by clicking F3 – F6
instructionsOverlay.track:
In this task, you must correct the cursor drift so it stays within the small square in the center.
When the green box with 'AUTO' turns blue with the text 'MANUAL', you need to manually correct the cursor position to keep it within the central square.
You control the cursor position with the WASD keys (W=up; A=left; S=down; D=right) or by clicking/touching and dragging.
instructionsOverlay.comm:
In this task you must respond to audio instructions about changing radio frequencies. Some messages are addressed to you (your callsign), but you must ignore others (addressed to other callsigns).
Your callsign is written at the top of the task (ESA504).

Controls:
1. To select the radio to change, use [UP] and [DOWN] arrow keys.
2. To change the frequency (number) for the selected radio, use [RIGHT] and [LEFT] arrow keys.
instructionsOverlay.resMan:
In this task you must maintain levels in the two main tanks (A and B) by using a set of reserve tanks and pumps, each with specific flow rates.
Your task is to toggle numbered pumps on and off to get tanks A and B as close to their normal levels as possible.
Normal levels for A and B tanks are indicated by the red line through the tank.
Pumps can sometimes fail, indicated by turning red.
Flow rates for different pumps are shown below the respective pump (when active).

Controls:
To turn pumps on or off, use the number keys corresponding to the pump number.
instructionsOverlay.multi:
The challenge is now to do all these tasks simultaneously.
Good luck!

customMode.intro: Select which tasks to activate and set their initial difficulty. Once the game starts, difficulty and frequency will increase over time just like in Normal Mode.

mainMenu.title: MATB-II Simulation
mainMenu.subtitle: Multi-Attribute Task Battery for Human-Automation Interaction Research
mainMenu.infiniteDesc: In Infinite Mode, you play until your health reaches zero. The difficulty increases faster than in Normal Mode. Your score is the time you survive.
mainMenu.testingDesc: Testing Mode allows you to freely experiment with all game components. You can enable/disable different tasks and adjust their difficulty.
mainMenu.pressCtrlQToReturn: During simulation, press Ctrl+Q to return to this menu
mainMenu.2minDesc: Quick validation run with all tasks enabled.
mainMenu.standardDesc: Full duration session for data collection.

reactionTest.title: Reaction Time Test
reactionTest.instructions: Test your reaction time by clicking or pressing SPACE as quickly as possible when you see a red dot.
reactionTest.testDetails: The test will last up to {{duration}} seconds with a maximum of {{maxStimuli}} stimuli.
reactionTest.getReady: Get ready for the next stimulus...
reactionTest.actionInstructions: Press SPACE or click the red dot when it appears
reactionTest.pressCtrlQToReturn: Press Ctrl+Q to return to the main menu at any time

nbackTest.title: N-Back Test
nbackTest.instructions: This is a dual n-back test with audio-visual and visuospatial components.
nbackTest.letterInstructions: Press L if the current letter matches the letter from {{n}} steps ago.
nbackTest.positionInstructions: Press A if the current square position matches the position from {{n}} steps ago.
nbackTest.testDetails: The test will consist of {{trials}} stimuli presented for {{time}} seconds each.
nbackTest.pressCtrlQToReturn: Press Ctrl+Q to return to the main menu at any time
nbackTest.matchInstructions: Press L for letter match, A for position match
nbackTest.dPrimeExplanation: d' is a more sensitive measure of performance that accounts for response bias

training.commOnlyDesc: Practice radio communication tasks in isolation.
training.trackingOnlyDesc: Practice manual and automatic tracking tasks in isolation.
training.resourceOnlyDesc: Practice fuel management and pump operations in isolation.
training.monitoringOnlyDesc: Practice gauge and light monitoring in isolation.
training.reactionOnlyDesc: Practice your reaction time and speed in isolation.
training.nbackOnlyDesc: Practice working memory and cognitive control in isolation.

tracking.title: Tracking Task
tracking.touchHint: Tap and drag to move the cursor to keep it within the target box.
tracking.controlsHelp: Use WASD keys or click/touch and drag to control cursor
tracking.controlsInstruction: You control the cursor position with the WASD keys (W=up; A=left; S=down; D=right) or by clicking/touching and dragging.
